text:
Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 10:32 pm Liverpool slumped to a 3-1 defeat to Leicester City on MOnday evening. (Getty Images) 
Liverpool felt the full fury from their fans on Monday evening after deciding to announce their new CEO just minutes after the 3-1 defeat to Leicester City. 
Jurgen Klopp’s side were comfortably beaten at the King Power Stadium as the Premier League champions repeatedly exploited the generous space left by Liverpool’s defence. 
But shortly after the final whistle, Liverpool decided that it was the opportune moment to confirm the appointment of Peter Moore as their new chief executive officer. 
Moore joins Anfield in June after nearly 10 years at Electronic Arts (EA) where he held a number of positions including chief operating officer and president of EA Sports. Peter Moore appointed as #LFC 's chief executive officer. 
— Liverpool FC (@LFC) February 27, 2017 
But Liverpool’s were less than impressed with the club’s decision to announce the news straight after another result which has dented their hopes of securing Champions League football.
